# check for attribute before setting attrDbserver=`/opt/rocks/bin/rocks list host attr localhost | /bin/grep LM_dbserver | /bin/awk '{print $3}'` if [ "$attrDbserver" = "" ] ; then /opt/rocks/bin/rocks add host attr localhost LM_dbserver value=true fi
/usr/sbin/usermod -G postgres pgbouncer export PATH=/usr/pgsql-9.2/bin:$PATH
# set mode to strict (2) to prevent postgres being killed by OOM /sbin/sysctl -w vm.overcommit_memory=2
# TODO: remove this text in clean-lm-server-roll.sh
# Postgres (for lifemapper) # Set overcommit_memory mode to strict to reduce chances of OOM killer invocation vm.overcommit_memory = 2
# create unix socket dir for postgres and pgbouncer # Configured @UNIXSOCKET@ == /var/run/postgresql in version.mk constants /bin/mkdir -p /var/run/postgresql /bin/chown postgres:postgres /var/run/postgresql /bin/chmod 0775 /var/run/postgresql
PG=`basename /usr/lib/systemd/system/postgresql-*.service` /usr/bin/systemctl enable $PG
/usr/bin/systemctl enable pgbouncer
# Execute on reboot. Log output goes to /tmp/post-99-lifemapper-lmserver.debug
#!/bin/bash # do LM initialization and start services
/opt/lifemapper/rocks/bin/checkLibs /opt/lifemapper/rocks/bin/initLM /bin/rm -rf /etc/rc.d/rocksconfig.d/post-99-lifemapper-lmserver
# may need this later for postgres tuning # /opt/rocks/bin/rocks set network mtu public 9000 # /opt/rocks/bin/rocks sync host network `hostname -s`
